bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 107 (Tuesday, July 5, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. RIBBLE:H.R. 5627.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:No section of Article I of the Constitution prohibitsCongress from honoring flora and fauna of the United States.[Page H4276]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

summary.text: This bill adopts the monarch butterfly as the national butterfly of the United States.

bill.title: To adopt the monarch butterfly as the national butterfly of the United States.

item.title: To adopt the monarch butterfly as the national butterfly of the United States.
To adopt the monarch butterfly as the national butterfly of the United States.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
